title: Executive Order Modifying Import Duties to Address Threats Posed by the Government of the Russian Federation
summary: This presidential action authorizes modifications to import duties on goods from the Russian Federation in response to identified threats. It cites authority under the International Emergency Economic Powers Act, the National Emergencies Act, and section 604 of the Trade Act of 1974, as amended, and directs relevant federal agencies to implement tariff changes consistent with these authorities. The objective of the order is to address threats to the United States attributed to the Government of the Russian Federation by adjusting tariff treatments for affected imports.

title: Executive Order Establishing a U.S. Arms Transfer Strategy to Prioritize U.S.-Manufactured Military Equipment Exports
summary: This presidential action establishes a government-wide strategy to coordinate and prioritize the transfer and export of United Statesâ€“manufactured military equipment. It aims to leverage the United States' comparative advantages in defense exports by directing interagency coordination across relevant federal departments, assessing related national security and export-control considerations, and aligning arms transfer activities with broader defense and foreign policy objectives.

title: Executive Order to Protect National Security and Welfare of the United States and Its Citizens from Criminal Actors and Other Public Safety Threats
summary: This executive order asserts the president's authority to safeguard the national security and welfare of the United States and its citizens from criminal actors and other public safety threats. It cites constitutional authority and statutory authority, including 6 U.S.C. 122(a)(2), and establishes the policy framework in Section 1 to protect national welfare and security. The document outlines that subsequent sections will define specific actions and measures to mitigate identified criminal and public safety risks and to coordinate federal efforts accordingly.

title: Modifying Duties to Address Threats to the United States by the Government of the Russian Federation
summary: A presidential action invoking authorities under the International Emergency Economic Powers Act, the National Emergencies Act, and related provisions of the Trade Act of 1974 to modify existing duties on imports. The action is taken to address threats associated with the Government of the Russian Federation, and it directs changes to tariff rates or classifications for affected goods, reflecting policy measures designed to respond to those threats in accordance with statutory authorities and national security considerations.

title: Proclamation Under the Antiquities Act Establishing the Northeast Canyons and Seamounts Marine National Monument
summary: On September 15, 2016, President Obama issued Proclamation 9496 under the Antiquities Act (54 U.S.C. 320301) establishing the Northeast Canyons and Seamounts Marine National Monument. The designation covers approximately 4,913 square miles of waters and submerged lands where the Atlantic Ocean meets the continental shelf, creating a federally protected marine area intended to preserve distinctive geological features and associated marine ecosystems in that region.

title: Proclamation on Beef Availability and Affordability for American Consumers
summary: This proclamation acknowledges the historical role of cattle ranchers in United States history and notes that beef remains a vital part of the American diet. It announces government actions aimed at promoting affordable beef for American consumers and supporting the beef supply chain.

title: Nomination of Michael McDonald to be Chairperson of the National Endowment for the Humanities for a four-year term
summary: The White House announced the nomination of Michael McDonald, of the District of Columbia, to serve as Chairperson of the National Endowment for the Humanities for a four-year term, succeeding Shelly C. Lowe. The nomination has been transmitted to the Senate for consideration.

title: Executive Order Addressing Threats to the United States by the Government of Cuba
summary: This executive order, issued by the President under the International Emergency Economic Powers Act and the National Emergencies Act, and under section 301 of title 3, United States Code, determines the actions to address threats to the United States posed by the Government of Cuba and orders measures to implement those actions. Section 1 establishes the initial determinations and directs applicable agencies to carry out the required measures.
